comments.commentBody: How do you know anything about Russia? Thru the CNN, and the likes? You have to know smth about the subject matter to allow youself to comment or it doesn't matter, because you live in the US and that's enough for the argument??? What do you know about Russia, Russian laws and so on? What is your source?

Putin was not barred by the constitution from standing in presidential elections again after his first two consecutive terms as president. He was legally elected again in 2012, since Dmitry Medvedev was president from 2008-2012. Hence, no consecutive third term for Putin.

Good relations between the West and Russia will have to wait until Putin has been deposed.

Putin was barred by the constitution from standing in presidential elections, having already served two consecutive terms as president.

He promptly disposed of that little constitutional issue by becoming president again in 2012.

Russia has no laws that are meaningful and consistently applied.

It spins so many lies despite self-evident truth to all with senses that words from the government are meaningless distractions.

No citizen there has security, rights or self-worth that can't be taken away in a moments breath.

Putin makes it very easy to understand what lever is effectively being deployed by the West and what isn't.

Sanctions are working and should be tightened. In addition, the West must strengthen and expand NATO. It must not allow the illegal expansion of Putin into sovereign territory.

Putin managed to put a constructive relationship with the world community back decades by returning his country to the Cold War.

He thinks the worst of people because he is the worst of people.

That's right, Aunt Nancy Loves Reefer, Putin has the blood of Malaysian Flight 17 on his bloody hands. Putin has the blood of 298 people on MH17. Nothing he or his trolls can say would ever change that. For that he will pay for it.

@James
The Russian trolls from the aforementioned "troll farms" are having a field day at our expense.
This may describe Bush pretty accurately.
Smells like Russian disinformation to me....

John, perhaps you can enlighten me as to where exactly, I commented on the USA pro, con, or otherwise?  I appreciate that you are paid to change the subject and muddy the waters in such discussion boards, but please, try not to be so obvious next time. This article is about Ukraine, and I am pointing out the original commenter's, and by extension, vladimir putin's, ongoing whoppers on Ukraine.

After reading about the Troll Farm, I absolutely have no idea what is what anymore. Our "think tanks" are like troll farms themselves here.
God help us all if the CIA and military are in charge of all this.

Actually I don't disagree with this. The US has been meddling in the CIS states, creating dissension and bloodshed for some time now. Ultraconservative US politicians need to get past an outdated Cold War mentality and work with Russia. (They have no problem with China, apparently.)
At the same time, it's hard to believe the people in Ukraine, Georgia, Chechnya, etc., are just sheep blindly following CIA backed puppet-masters.
Still, the US' "contain Russia" policy is resulting in death and ruined lives. I'm disappointed Obama has bought into this attitude.
No she didn't.  The $5 billion was money donated to NGOs over the course of 20+ years.

SO they are simply learning from what the USA has done.

Victoria Nuland boasted about the USA spending $5 billion in Ukraine to get the government that the USA wanted - and this non democratic coup by the USA is the cause of the crisis.

Try doing an article on the National Endowment for Democracy - an interfering, CIA front organisation that does much more interfering than the Russians can ever hope to do!
In other words, nothing has changed since Lenin took over back in 1917.
Manipulation and Corruption are two ideal terms that best describes what goes on in Russia today. Tainted with corruption.

Oh please.  Anyone who has been following the decline of Russia over the last several years knows that its "government" is a constructed hybrid of the old KBG and organized crime.  That is really a shame, but we need to accept facts as they are.  It is so unfortunate.  The Russian people have so much to offer the world.

Seeing as America has been the military might for the entire free world since the end of WWII I doubt the free world is going to do to much except complain when something we do goes wrong. As for a lot the countries we "destroyed" you need to look to see who was the original instigator. Had Russia not invaded Afghanistan in 1979 the Middle East today might possibly be very different. Although when you're dealing with people whose tribal heritage is more important then the country they live in I'm not sure.

You are right.  Republican aren't any less Keynesian than Democrats.  As long as both advocate that a central bank fixes interest rates and subsidizes fractional reserve banks with liquidity, the only difference between the two is if the extra money the state has to spend to combat unemployment goes into weapons or welfare.

It's surprising to me that people seem genuinely to believe that "no real American" could have a different view from their own.  It's a variant on the old "no real Scotsman" logical fallacy, and of course, fallacies do persuade people, which is why they are used in the first place.  But actually hearing and responding to other people's views should be possible, and the testing of one's own views should be a part of that.  If there's evidence, hear it; but arguing bad faith on others' parts to silence them is not the way to truth--if that's what you're looking for.

Please don't disregard people who are in favor of Russia's actions as trolls just because it doesn't match your perspective of the issue. Past, your first paragraph, everything else seems to be fairly proper.

comments may vary but one can object to the over-aggressive position of the West here without necessarily being a Putin 'apologist'.    Whether it was in Iraq at the start of the war, or in Cold War issues in Central America and Southern Africa, and Southeast Asia, objection to the policy is routinely equated with being soft on or a pawn of the baddie on the other side who is the target

Reading some of the comments in support of Putin truly underscores the NYT article about the Russian trolls paid by the government to spread disinformation.

I don't know who these Russian trolls believe the are influencing, but I can assure them that they are high comedy to educated and well-informed NYT readers.

We all know America is not perfect. We all know no country in the world is perfect.

But I will take America's legal system, freedom of speech, educational system, business environment and respect for individualism any day of the week over Russia.

We can discuss America's imperfections and not fear arrest, expropriation of all our possessions or death.

We believe in a Constitution that doesn't change weekly.

Despite all our disagreements, we move forward to attempt to achieve the equality, freedom and protections articulated by our nation's Founders.

People are trying to immigrate to the United States while they are trying to emigrate from Russia.

That fairly sums it up.

Hmmm.  Fascists are right-wingers.  Their current historical "king" might be Hitler.  Prime minister, Nietzsche - or Franco or Battista or Mussolini, Hirohito or Cheney, at least as I have digested history.  Left-wingers include Marx, of course, and Lenin, Castro and most Russian premiers since Stalin - including Putin.  These are negative-fascists, or communists.  It helps to think of this as a spectrum from far left to far right (or vice-versa) with someone like Hillary Clinton slightly right of center and someone like Bernie Sanders slightly left of center.  These are just facts - which it seems like it would be helpful to political debate for folks to know.

Lou Andrews, none of the Ukrainian tragedy, with the loss of thousands of lives, would have happened if Washington hadn't organized the coup d'etat against the democratically elected government of Ukraine. If you wanted that government out, and were so sure of winning, why wasn't it possible to wait for the election?

To those who say, well, the demonstrations in Kiev showed the government was unpopular, I'm sorry, but elections decide that. In the late 1960s and early 1970s, there were huge anti-war and anti-Nixon demonstrations in Washington. Nixon won the 1972 elections in a landslide. Ditto Hugo Chavez, repeatedly, in elections in Venezuela, despite very large demonstrations against him. The same in Thailand, where despite huge demonstrations by the rightist Bangkok elite, the left has continued to win elections overwhelmingly, to the point where the Bangkok elite has called for abandoning elections, which they say are not suitable for Thailand, and endorsed the latest military coup d'etat and military dictatorship.

This is not a good precedent.

You simply have to look and see how NATO has been encircling Russia to explain why they "took" Crimea back. Meanwhile, how many countries has the U.S. invaded, bombed or occupied in the past few years? Russia has clear cause to defend her own interests.

Martin, I'm going to bed. What happened to your Warriors?

Puzzle connection: DEMOLITION.
Stealing Kosovo from Serbia and  helping Syrian rebels is enough justification for "outrageous" Russia's behavior. You can not expect others play by the rules, that you yourself disregard
Thousands of troops? I will simply respond by saying "prove it", IPI.

It would not be helpful to have Tony Blair's signature. He is a sad joke in the eyes of British people. Americans may still think of him well ? but in Europe he has become an increasing embarrassment whose only interest now is making obscene amounts of money while doing useless work. What will never happen is exactly what should happen, Bush and Blair need to stand trial for lying to the countries and taking them to war. The only reason this has not happened is that current leaders fear a trial like this would set a precedent, which they may be uncomfortable with.
One omission from the signatories, no less noteworthy for the fact that he's no longer an MP, is Tony Blair.
The West supports Russian opposition, and nobody thinks it is bad, but why Russian supports legal parties of the West should be bad?

Russian troll dead giveaway:  "coup" in Ukraine.   Lots of other ways to spot one:  Use of "neocon" regarding anything about Russia or Ukraine, use of "Nazi" or "Victoria Nuland" regarding anything about Ukraine, failure to refute facts combined with criticism of the West.  *yawn*
“And it’s useful for the Russians themselves not to refute rumors and maybe even perpetrate some of them. They want everyone to think everyone is corrupt, everyone can be influenced.”

MVT2216: "... there are these antique car clubs whose members drive lots of vehicles that most of us would never dream of driving on a day-to-day basis. I suspect one of them would be interested in an old Edsel."

Edsels today are fairly valuable because they are quite rare, as most of them were unceremoniously scrapped by the early sixties, as they were malfunctioning, prematurely rusting junk.
Did you actually just compare Shakespeare to the numbskulls that write for GOT? Man the NYT readership has gone downhill.
Samuel, I guess you have never read "Titus Andronicus."

"Let's see... holy books full of rape and murder and rampage and destruction on a massive scale, including burning entire cities full of children."

- sounds like the bible.

Let's see... holy books full of rape and murder and rampage and destruction on a massive scale, including burning entire cities full of children.

The greatest writer in literature, William Shakespeare, author of countless atrocities against men, women, children of all ages.

Any number of mobster movies with every dismemberment scenario the human mind can imagine in them, now called classics.

Tonight's episode was disturbing. It was supposed to be. But it was nothing new if the history of fiction and nothing to be particularly outraged by in a show about these characters in this setting that is meant for adults.
